title: Rhiwargor Waterfall Walking Route

images.title: Eirian Evans / Rhiwargor Car Park, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Rhiwargor Car Park at the northern end of Lake Vyrnwy. There is a path from the end of the car park to the Rhiwargor Falls.

images.title: andy / Waterfall, Rhiwargor, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Waterfall, Rhiwargor. Falls on the Afon Eiddew that runs into Llyn Efyrnwy (Lake Vyrnwy)

images.title: Claire Willatt / Rhiwargor Waterfall, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: This spectacular high waterfall, one of hidden gems of Wales, gushes down the heather clad slopes of the valley of Afon Eiddew, is known locally as Pistyll Rhyd-y-meincau

images.title: Penny Mayes / Crag above Rhiwargor, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Crag above Rhiwargor

images.title: Eirian Evans / Horse Sculpture, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Horse Sculpture By Andy Hancock as part of the Sculpture Trail around Lake Vyrnwy. This one is at the entrance to the Rhiwargor car park at the northern end of the lake.

images.title: Sean the Spook at the English language Wikipedia [CC BY-SA 3.0 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Close in view, taken halfway up the falls.

description: Visit these beautiful falls near Lake Vyrnwy on this short walk in Powys. The Rhiwargor Trail takes you along the Afon Eiddew to a series of pretty waterfalls. You can park at the Rhiwargor Waterfall car park at the northern end of the lake. From here you get direct access to the footpaths along the river to the falls. It's a lovely area with the rushing river surrounded by attractive woodland and the steep hills of the Afon Eiddew Valley. There's picnic areas by the water, nice grassy paths and a stream crossing on some stepping stones. You can extend your walk by strolling along the lovely Lake Vyrnwy. The area is also a RSPB nature reserve so you can look out for a variety of birds including great crested grebes, dippers and buzzards. There's bike hire at the southern end of the lake so you could hire a bike and cycle to the falls from Llanwddyn.
